laboratory_examinations.findings: Shortening of long bones, narrowing of the chest with short ribs, bowing of the femur, excess soft tissues on thighs and lower legs, suspicion of retrognathia, and ulnar deviation of the wrist observed at 14 weeks of gestation. Bilateral brachydactyly of the hands, mild polyhydramnios, moderate pericardial effusion, small hydrothorax, mild retrognathia and severe shortening of the ribs with high probability of pulmonary hypoplasia detected at 17 weeks of gestation.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The shortening of long bones assessed as severe at both 14 and 17 weeks of gestation, with specific measurements: femur length at 14.2 mm vs. expected 25 mm (three standard deviations below the median) and fibula length 9.2 mm (more than three standard deviations below the median).
